org.firstinspires.ftc.team9202hme.hardware.driving

Class HolonomicDriveTrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.team9202hme.hardware.HardwareComponent
      • org.firstinspires.ftc.team9202hme.hardware.driving.DriveTrain
        • org.firstinspires.ftc.team9202hme.hardware.driving.HolonomicDriveTrain

  • public class HolonomicDriveTrain
extends DriveTrain
    Drive train made for robots using the holonomic drive configuration. This class assumes that the wheels are in "X" configuration, where wheels are at 45 degree angles on the corners of the robot. It also assumes that every wheel is the same diameter, and each corresponding motor has the same number of encoder ticks per rotation
    Author:
    Nathaniel Glover

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HolonomicDriveTrain(double mmWheelDiameter, int encoderTicksPerRotation)
      Gives HolonomicDriveTrain the values it needs to calculate how to properly apply motor powers when moving and turning at set distances

    • Constructor Detail

      • HolonomicDriveTrain

        public HolonomicDriveTrain(double mmWheelDiameter,
                           int encoderTicksPerRotation)
        Gives HolonomicDriveTrain the values it needs to calculate how to properly apply motor powers when moving and turning at set distances
        Parameters:
        mmWheelDiameter - The diameter of the robot's wheels, in millimeters
        encoderTicksPerRotation - The number of ticks given off by each motor's encoder each rotation. If you are using Andymark Neverest 40's, then this value is 1120

      • driveControlled

        public void driveControlled(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad controller)
        Description copied from class: DriveTrain
        Sets motor powers to drive the robot based on input from a gamepad. This is meant to be used in TeleOpProgram.loop()
        Specified by:
        driveControlled in class DriveTrain
        Parameters:
        controller - The gamepad that will be used to control the robot. It should ideally come from the OpMode in the program that will be controlling the robot, as either gamepad1 or gamepad2
        See Also:
        TeleOpProgram

      • move

        public void move(double power,
                 double angle)
        Description copied from class: DriveTrain
        Sets the motor powers so that the robot moves at the specified speed and angle
        Specified by:
        move in class DriveTrain
        Parameters:
        power - The power that will be applied to the motors, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0
        angle - The angle, in degrees, where 0 degrees is the front of the robot, at which the robot will move

      • move

        public void move(double power,
                 double angle,
                 double distance)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: DriveTrain
        Sets the motor powers so that the robot moves at the specified speed and angle, until it has reached the specified distance

        NOTE: Do not catch the InterruptedException. This method is intended for use in AutonomousProgram.run(), which will properly handle the InterruptedException should it occur.

        Specified by:
        move in class DriveTrain
        Parameters:
        power - The power that will be applied to the motors, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0
        angle - The angle, in degrees, where 0 degrees is the front of the robot, at which the robot will move
        distance - The distance, in millimeters, that the robot will move
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        See Also:
        AutonomousProgram

      • turn

        public void turn(double power)
        Description copied from class: DriveTrain
        Sets the motor powers so that the robot spins
        Specified by:
        turn in class DriveTrain
        Parameters:
        power - The power that will be applied to the motors, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0, where a negative power will cause the robot to spin counter-clockwise

      • turn

        public void turn(double power,
                 double angle)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: DriveTrain
        Sets the motor powers so that the robot spins, until it reaches the desired angle

        NOTE: Do not catch the InterruptedException. This method is intended for use in AutonomousProgram.run(), which will properly handle the InterruptedException should it occur.

        Specified by:
        turn in class DriveTrain
        Parameters:
        power - The power that will be applied to the motors, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0, where a negative power will cause the robot to spin counter-clockwise
        angle - The angle in degrees to which the robot will turn, ranging from -359 to 359, where 0 is the front of the robot and negative values cause a counter-clockwise turn
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        See Also:
        AutonomousProgram

      • moveAndTurn

        public void moveAndTurn(double movePower,
                        double angle,
                        double turnPower)
        Description copied from class: DriveTrain
        Sets the motor powers so that the robot moves at the desired angle, while simultaneously spinning
        Specified by:
        moveAndTurn in class DriveTrain
        Parameters:
        movePower - The power that will be applied to the motors, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0
        angle - The angle, in degrees, where 0 degrees is the front of the robot, at which the robot will move
        turnPower - The power that will be applied to the motors, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0, where a negative power will cause the robot to spin counter-clockwise
